p: TD is a frequent medical problem in travelers from high-income countries to lower-income countries, affecting 20%–60% of travelers to low-income regions. It can be defined as three or more loose stools in a 24 hour period with or without other symptoms of fever, nausea, or cramps [ 64]. TD is usually an acute, self-limiting presentation and rarely causes life-threatening disease, but it can be a significant cause of distress to travelers due to disrupted holiday plans. It may also have longer-term consequences in the form of postinfectious irritable bowel syndrome [ 65].
